results.title: Mighty Aphrodite
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Sweetland Films BV and Magnolia Productions
results.brief_description: Writer-director Woody Allen plays Lenny, a sportswriter who is dissatisfied in his marriage to art dealer, Amanda. Lenny becomes obsessed with locating his adopted son’s natural mother, feeling convinced that she will be a brilliant and intelligent person. Instead she’s Linda, a ditzy porn star and prostitute. Despite the initial disillusionment, Lenny soon develops a fondness for Linda, and decides to help her get her life back on track. Cast includes: Woody Allen, Mira Sorvino, Helena Bonham Carter, Michael Rapaport, F. Murray Abraham, Olympia Dukakis and Peter Weller.

results.title: Miffy: best friends are great
results.creator_credit: Toshio Nishiuchi, Yoshimasa Mizou, Yukiko Omura, Yuzuru Otagawa, Mercis Media, Japan Inc, Dick Bruna and Kodansha
results.brief_description: The stories of Miffy and her friends have enchanted and entertained young children for many years. Based on Dick Bruna’s children’s books, this video provides a safe and caring environment where children can discover and explore a wide range of emotions. The following 10 episodes are included: Best friends are great; Miffy’s magnifying glass; Snip with scissors; Who are you?; Like or not?; What’s behind the door?; Hide and seek; Somehow different; Same or different?; Big or small?

results.title: Miffy at the zoo
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Palm Plus, Hilversham, Kodansha, Meulenoff and Hertogenbosch
results.brief_description: Miffy, Dick Bruna’s lovable white rabbit is off to the zoo with her father. They travel by train and see lots of animals. The seven other stories are: 1. The Christmas book. - 2. The Circus. - 3. Another story to tell. - 4. Miffy at the playground. - 5. Snuffy’s puppies. - 6. The Fish. - 7. Poppy pig. The bold colours and solid shapes of the illustrations, accompanied by simple but entertaining stories make this highly suitable for young children.

results.title: Miffy at the hospital
results.brief_description: Based on the delightful children’s books by Dick Bruna about Miffy, the white rabbit, this tape includes 8 adventures with Miffy including: The Orchestra- Miffy at the hospital- Poppy’s birthday- The School- The Little Bird- Cinderella- Red Riding Hood and The Apple. Suitable for young children.

results.title: Miffy
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Palm Plus, Hilvershum, Kodansha, Meulenoff and Hertogenbosch
results.brief_description: Miffy is a familiar friend to generations of very young children. Together with Snuffy, Farmer John, Poppy Pig, Boris and Barbara, she features in the family of characters from Dick Bruna’s much loved children’s books. These simple yet captivating stories will take children into the delightful world of Miffy and her friends. 1-Miffy 2-Miffy’s bicycle 3-Miffy at school 4-I Know about numbers 5-Miffy goes flying 6-Farmer John 7-Miffy’s dream 8-Snuffy.

results.title: Midwife: with woman
results.creator_credit: Mary Paul Wells and Maternity Centre Association
results.brief_description: This film traces the history of midwifery in America, describing its prominent role in colonial times, and its gradual restriction through professional standardisation. It also shows the process through which midwifery has regained acceptance and the film emphasises the view that pregnancy is not an illness and childbirth is not a surgical operation. Narrated by Mariette Hartley.

results.title: Midnite spares
results.creator_credit: Quentin Masters, Tom Burstall and Filmco
results.brief_description: A group of criminals strip cars for their parts and are involved in a kidnapping. When the man’s son returns home after a long absence, he embarks on a chaotic rescue mission with the help of a few friends. Stars James Laurie, Gia Carides, Max Cullen and Bruce Spence.

results.title: Midnight song = Ye ban ge sheng
results.creator_credit: Yang Yanjin and Shanghai Film Studio
results.brief_description:
This is the Chinese version of the Phantom of the Opera. Sun Xiao’ou and Lü Die heard that the local theatre was haunted by a ghost as their performance troupe arrived in the small city. One night they saw a crazy young lady in the theatre. The young lady looked very distressful and asked Xiao’ou to take her away to another place. Xiao’ou learns from the young lady’s nanny that the lady, Li Xiaoxia, is actually the daughter of a rich local businessman. Xiaoxia fell in love with a handsome actor, Song Danping, a few years ago but the proposed marriage was strongly opposed by Xiaoxia’s father, who asked Xiaoxia’s cousin, Tang to murder Xiaoxia’s lover, Song. Song escaped Tang’s murder but was disfigured by vitriol. Song committed suicide by drowning himself in a river and everybody believed he was dead. Song’s death drove Xiaoxia mad, but in fact Song didn’t die. Xiao’ou felt so sorrowful for the couple and one day he ran across Song, who passed him a script, asking Xiao’ou to sing the opera for him and save Xiaoxia. Xiao’ou singing awakes Xiaoxia, who learns that Song is still alive. Song refuses to see Xiaoxia as his face is completely distorted and covered by a mask. Xiaoxia blinds her eyes in order to be with Song. Now Xiaoxia is blind, Tang wants to get Xiao’ou’s girlfriend, Lü Die. However, Tang killed Lü Die accidentally before Song turns up to save her. Tang escaped and incited the crowds to kill the “ghost”, Song. Xiaoxia and Song escaped to a pagoda in the dark night and the crowds burnt the pagoda. The lovers are finally together and died in the fire.

Midnight Song has different film versions and has been adapted to a TV series in Hong Kong. The earliest version is the 1937 one directed by Maxu Weibang. In 1995, the story is re-interpreted by Hong Kong director, Yu Rentai (also known as Ronny Yu). The 1995 version, The Phantom Lover, stars Hong Kong pop singer Leslie Cheung, who played in Farewell My Concubine. (4 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)
